pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
Looks good, thanks!

bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7524123514/job/20478460927)

I'm going to assume that was a random transient failure and try again.

bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7524334618/job/20478989708)

> I'm going to assume that was a random transient failure and try again.

There are uncaught exceptions:
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7524334618/job/20478989708#step:17:4161

Still, it might be intermittent, so I'll try once more as a test.

bors r+

Build failed:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7524604831/job/20479679400)
It was worth a shot. Meanwhile, Mario found that the source of the error is `curl` exiting with a nonzero status code.
@kmill you may now merge master and re-merge this.
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7527143500/job/20486699030)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7527143500/job/20486698634)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7527143500/job/20486698834)

For a `feat` PR, it's better practice to not mix refactoring into it, unless you can find some reviewer who thinks it's immediately a good idea and is OK with the distraction of interleaved non-feature changes.

I'm not sure removing `Subgroup.` and `FreeGroup.` is an improvement myself, but I don't know that it's not an improvement either (this isn't a corner of mathlib I typically do reviews for). If you limit the PR to just adding `equivPresentedGroup` you'll have a better shot at getting it quickly reviewed.
@kmill Understood.  I will revert the last commit.

I think you want `rels` to be an explicit argument to `equivPresentedGroup`, right? That way you can write `equivPresentedGroup rels e` and specify `rels`.

Definitions should generally come with some minimal API that characterizes them. The main one I can think of is `equivPresentedGroup_apply_of` (if I got the name right). That would be something like `equivPresentedGroup rels e (PresentedGroup.of x) = PresentedGroup.of (e x)`. You could also throw in `equivPresentedGroup_symm_apply_of` for `(equivPresentedGroup rels e).symm (PresentedGroup.of x) = PresentedGroup.of (e.symm x)`, and you probably can deduce it from the previous one.

```suggestion
    PresentedGroup rels ≃* PresentedGroup (FreeGroup.freeGroupCongr e '' rels) :=
```

```suggestion
    (Subgroup.normalClosure ((FreeGroup.freeGroupCongr e) '' rels)) (FreeGroup.freeGroupCongr e)
```

I'm surprised these `rels` hints are needed. We can remove a couple of them to tidy it up. In any case, for the second theorem we want the `e.symm (e x)` to be simplified to `x`. We can also make it more general when rewriting left-to-right by having it be in terms of `(x : β)`. Here:
```suggestion
theorem equivPresentedGroup_apply_of (x : α) (rels : Set (FreeGroup α)) (e : α ≃ β) :
    equivPresentedGroup rels e (PresentedGroup.of x) =
      PresentedGroup.of (rels := FreeGroup.freeGroupCongr e '' rels) (e x) := rfl

theorem equivPresentedGroup_symm_apply_of (x : β) (rels : Set (FreeGroup α)) (e : α ≃ β) :
    (equivPresentedGroup rels e).symm (PresentedGroup.of x) =
      PresentedGroup.of (rels := rels) (e.symm x) := rfl
```

I just edited that. Turns out the second one is true by `rfl` rather than a more involved `rw` proof.

By the way, making the proof be `rfl` instead of `by rfl` makes it available to use with `dsimp`.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Group presentations of isomorphic types are isomorphic.
